title: Eunice Kennedy Shriver
summary: Eunice Mary Kennedy Shriver DSG (July 10, 1921 â€“ August 11, 2009) was an American philanthropist[1] and a member of the Kennedy family. She was the founder of the Special Olympics, a sports organization for persons with physical and intellectual disabilities. For her efforts on behalf of the disabled, Shriver was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom in 1984.
